glsa.title: OpenOffice.org: Heap overflow in included libcurl
glsa.synopsis: OpenOffice.org contains a vulnerable version of libcurl that may cause a heap overflow when parsing URLs.

background.p: OpenOffice.org is an office productivity suite, including word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, data charting, formula editing and file conversion facilities. libcurl, which is included in OpenOffice.org, is a free and easy-to-use client-side library for transferring files with URL syntaxes, supporting numerous protocols.

description.p: OpenOffice.org includes libcurl code. This libcurl code is vulnerable to a heap overflow when it tries to parse a URL that exceeds a 256-byte limit (GLSA 200512-09).

impact.p: An attacker could entice a user to call a specially crafted URL with OpenOffice.org, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
